title: Kevin Locke, Who Worked to Preserve Lakota Culture, Dies at 68
description: Playing the wooden flute and performing hoop dances, he sought to introduce audiences throughout the nation to Native American traditions.
dc:creator: Neil Genzlinger
media:description: Kevin Locke performing in the Badlands in South Dakota in 2002. An acclaimed Native American flute player and hoop dancer, he became a cultural ambassador for the Lakota tribe.
